Recommended Reason: Anglo-Saxon ship burial site with exceptional archaeological finds
Supporting Evidence: 1939 discovery revealed royal burial chamber with gold helmet, weapons, and Byzantine artifacts

Recommended Reason: Site of largest Anglo-Saxon gold hoard ever discovered
Supporting Evidence: 2009 discovery of 4,600 items including 5.1kg gold, 1.4kg silver, suggesting more sites nearby

Recommended Reason: Site of largest Roman treasure hoard found in Britain
Supporting Evidence: 1992 discovery of 15,000 coins and 200 silver/gold objects, valued at £4.5M today

Recommended Reason: One of largest Viking silver hoards, suggests more Viking caches
Supporting Evidence: 1840 discovery of 8,600 items including coins from Scandinavia, Italy, and Byzantium

Recommended Reason: Largest Roman coin hoard found in single vessel
Supporting Evidence: 2010 discovery of 52,503 Roman coins, indicating Roman settlement activity

Recommended Reason: Viking silver hoard with unique artifacts and cup
Supporting Evidence: 2007 discovery included rare gilt silver vessel and 617 coins
